DataElement.preferredName: Spleen Palpable Size Measurement Centimeter Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The numerical value that represents the measurement in centimeters of the spleen by being touched or felt.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An organ that is part of the lymphatic system. The spleen produces lymphocytes, filters the blood, stores blood cells, and destroys old blood cells. It is located on the left side of the abdomen near the stomach._Capable of being handled or touched or felt._The physical magnitude of something._Measurement is the determination of the size or magnitude of something.  It is also used ro refer to the result of this act.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An organ that is part of the lymphatic system. The spleen produces lymphocytes, filters the blood, stores blood cells, and destroys old blood cells. It is located on the left side of the abdomen near the stomach.

Concepts.definition: An organ that is part of the hematopoietic and immune systems. It is composed of the white pulp and the red pulp and is surrounded by a capsule. It is located in the left hypochondriac region. Its functions include lymphocyte production, blood cell storage, and blood cell destruction.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: any measurements, including linear dimensions, volume, and weight, of a patient's anatomic organs.

Concepts.definition: Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.
A basic unit of length in the former CGS version of metric system, equal to one hundredth of a meter or approximately 0.393 700 787 inch.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
